info.name: KYC-AMLBOT
info.description:
# AMLBot KYC API Collection

This collection contains all the API endpoints for integrating with AMLBot's KYC (Know Your Customer) and AML (Anti-Money Laundering) verification services.

## API Flow

The typical KYC verification flow is:

1. **Create Applicant** - Register the person/company in AMLBot
2. **Upload Files** - Upload document images (passport, ID, etc.)
3. **Create Documents** - Link uploaded files to document types
4. **Create Verification** - Start the verification process

## Authentication

All requests require the `Authorization` header with a Token:
```
Authorization: Token YOUR_API_KEY
```

## Base URL

- Production: `https://kyc-api.amlbot.com`

## Response Format

All responses are in JSON format.

## Rate Limits

Refer to AMLBot documentation for current rate limits.

item.name: Applicants
item.description: Manage applicants (persons or companies) for KYC verification.

request.description:
Create a new applicant for KYC verification.

**Required Fields:**
- `type`: "PERSON" or "COMPANY"

**Optional Fields for PERSON:**
- `first_name`: First name
- `last_name`: Last name
- `dob`: Date of birth (YYYY-MM-DD)
- `residence_country`: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code
- `nationality`: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code
- `email`: Email address
- `phone`: Phone number (E.164 format)

**Response:**
```json
{
    "applicant_id": "abc123..."
}
```

Update an existing applicant's information.

**URL Parameters:**
- `applicant_id`: The ID of the applicant to update

**Body:** Same fields as Create Applicant (only include fields to update)

Retrieve an applicant's details by ID.

**URL Parameters:**
- `applicant_id`: The ID of the applicant

**Response:** Full applicant object with all details

item.name: Files
item.description: Upload and manage files (document images) for verification.

formdata.description: The document image file (PNG, JPG, PDF supported)

request.description:
Upload a document image file to AMLBot.

**Important:** This must be done BEFORE creating a document record.

**Supported Formats:**
- Images: PNG, JPG, JPEG
- Documents: PDF

**Response:**
```json
{
    "file_id": "f15124cd1219b2403f2a9813fee26ef7e67b"
}
```

Save the `file_id` to use when creating documents.

Replace an existing file with a new one.

**URL Parameters:**
- `file_id`: The ID of the file to replace

Get information about an uploaded file.

**URL Parameters:**
- `file_id`: The ID of the file

Delete an uploaded file.

**URL Parameters:**
- `file_id`: The ID of the file to delete

**Note:** Files attached to documents cannot be deleted.

item.name: Documents
item.description: Create and manage document records that link uploaded files to document types.

request.description:
Create a document record linking uploaded files to a document type.

**IMPORTANT:** You must upload files first and get their `file_id` values.

**Required Fields:**
- `applicant_id`: The applicant this document belongs to
- `type`: Document type (see below)
- `front_side_id`: File ID of the front side image

**Optional Fields:**
- `back_side_id`: File ID of the back side image (for 2-sided docs)
- `document_number`: Document number
- `issue_date`: Issue date (YYYY-MM-DD)
- `expiry_date`: Expiry date (YYYY-MM-DD)

**Document Types:**
- `PASSPORT` - Passport
- `GOVERNMENT_ID` - National ID card
- `DRIVERS_LICENSE` - Driver's license
- `SELFIE` - Selfie photo
- `FINANCIAL_DOCUMENT` - Bank statement, tax doc, etc.
- `OTHER` - Other documents

**Note:** Only ONE document per type is allowed per applicant.

**Response:**
```json
{
    "document_id": "9614d5071d7bb24e702a00f30ae3fb39602d"
}
```

Update an existing document record.

**URL Parameters:**
- `document_id`: The ID of the document to update

Get details of a document record.

**URL Parameters:**
- `document_id`: The ID of the document

Delete a document record.

**URL Parameters:**
- `document_id`: The ID of the document to delete

**Note:** Documents attached to verifications cannot be deleted.

List all documents for an applicant.

**URL Parameters:**
- `applicant_id`: The ID of the applicant

Create a verification request for an applicant WITHOUT using a form.

**IMPORTANT:** Documents must be uploaded and created BEFORE calling this.

**Required Fields:**
- `applicant_id`: The applicant to verify
- `types`: Array of verification types

**Optional Fields:**
- `callback_url`: Webhook URL for verification results

**Verification Types:**
- `DOCUMENT` - ID document verification
- `AML` - AML/sanctions screening (requires FINANCIAL_DOCUMENT)
- `SELFIE` - Selfie liveness check
- `LIVENESS` - Advanced liveness detection

**Response:**
```json
{
    "verification_id": "abc123...",
    "status": "pending"
}
```

Create a verification request using a pre-configured form.

**When to use:**
- When you want users to upload documents through AMLBot's UI
- When you need specific document requirements defined in a form

**Required Fields:**
- `applicant_id`: The applicant to verify
- `types`: Array of verification types
- `form_id`: ID of the form to use (get from /forms endpoint)

**Note:** If using form_id, the form must exist in your AMLBot account.

Get the status and results of a verification.

**URL Parameters:**
- `verification_id`: The ID of the verification

**Response includes:**
- `status`: pending, in_progress, completed, failed
- `result`: approved, declined, review_needed
- `risk_score`: Numerical risk score

List all verifications for an applicant.

**Query Parameters:**
- `applicant_id`: The ID of the applicant

item.name: Forms
item.description: Manage KYC forms and generate form URLs for users.

request.description:
Generate a URL for users to complete KYC through AMLBot's hosted form.

**Use this when:**
- You want users to upload documents through AMLBot's UI
- You don't want to handle document uploads yourself

**Required Fields:**
- `applicant_id`: The applicant who will complete the form

**Optional Fields:**
- `redirect_url`: URL to redirect user after completion
- `external_applicant_id`: Your internal user ID

**Response:**
```json
{
    "form_url": "https://kyc.amlbot.com/...",
    "verification_id": "abc123...",
    "expires_at": "2024-01-01T00:00:00Z"
}
```

Send the `form_url` to your user to complete KYC.

**This is a REFERENCE for the webhook payload AMLBot sends.**

This is NOT an API you call - this is what AMLBot sends to YOUR callback_url.

**Events:**
- `verification.completed` - Verification finished
- `verification.failed` - Verification failed
- `verification.updated` - Verification status changed

**Result Values:**
- `approved` - Passed verification
- `declined` - Failed verification
- `review_needed` - Manual review required

**Signature Verification:**
The `X-AMLBot-Signature` header contains an HMAC-SHA256 signature that you should verify against your webhook secret.

Test the connection to AMLBot from your iTransfr backend.

**Response:**
```json
{
    "success": true,
    "message": "AMLBot API connection successful",
    "apiKeyConfigured": true
}
```
List available AMLBot forms through the iTransfr API.
